comments:
I have just installed eclipse 3.0M8 for the Suns/Linux machines in our department.
If I erase ".eclipse" and then run the environment from a Linux machine, I can
run as many times as I want successfully, but if I try to start the environment
from a Sun, I get a single window with "Eclipse" as the title, containing the text:
"/cs/home/jas/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.0.0/configuration/1085076506218.log"
with an "OK" button.  When I click on "OK", the program exits.  If I view the
file, I see:

!SESSION May 20, 2004 14:08:35.815 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=solaris, ARCH=sparc, WS=motif, NL=en
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi May 20, 2004 14:08:35.828
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Listener
        at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:151)
        at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:66)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:277)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:239)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:117)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)

If I then erase ".eclipse" and run from the Suns, everything works until I run
eclipse run the Linux systems, and then I get a similar error.  Is there somet
platform dependent configuration that is coming into play here? It seems
strange.  Both systems have the identical Java version setup (1.4.2_04).

Any ideas?

The issue with the dialog has been fixed in recent builds (check i20040520, for
instance).

Moving to Equinox for comments on the issue of running multiple read-only
installs. Don't know if it has been fixed.

Please retry with M9.  There have been significant changes in this area.  Also, 
if you are running in a shared configuration then you should mark the 
configuration area as read/only.  This way the linux users will get a config 
dir in their area and the sun users will get one in theirs.
Retried with M9.  This solved the problem.  Thank you.
